content: [alette] And let the varl die to give us a head start?
[alette eyvind] Contacted you how?
[alette eyvind] It must have something to do with the dredge returning.
[alette eyvind] We're from a very small town in the woods.
[alette] Just keeping an eye on him. It's not like that, dad. He saved Iver. He might save the rest of us.
[alette] There has to be some way to... I can't believe the varl would be so stubborn!
[alette] What about the serpent?
[eyvind] And the varl will try to stop me. It could mean holding off both the dredge and the varl.
[eyvind] Either way we can't stay. We have to make it to Sigrholm. Juno will know what to do.
[eyvind] For the most part the dredge haven't tried to return since. Well, until now.
[eyvind] He'll let the city, and the rest of the world, fall before that damned bridge.
[eyvind] How long was I..?
[eyvind] Humanity was on the brink of extinction when the inner circle of menders went forth, and finally sent the Sundr and the dredge deep underground.
[eyvind] I can't completely understand it myself. The last time I mentioned it he made his mind very clear.
[eyvind] I can't stop him, but I believe Juno can. That's why we need to go. We could just leave...
[eyvind] I'll keep it short.
[eyvind] In the first great war, the armies of men and varl hated each other, they fought bitterly for land and dominance.
[eyvind] It's not my first choice. I've done everything I can on my own.
[eyvind] I understand. Be quick, Rook.
[eyvind] Juno. She's alive! I need to meet her in Sigrholm.
[eyvind] Look, I know things are... it's, it's a long story. How well do you know history?
[eyvind] Maybe, or... no, I could destroy that god-forsaken bridge myself. That would delay the immediate threat, but... Jorundr will never agree to it.
[eyvind] Not by myself. I could blast it apart, but this bridge wasn't made to fall. It'll take time, and concentration.
[eyvind rook] If I didn't think the world was ending it would be incredible. Ancient history is playing out before us.
[eyvind] Rook, I hate to put all this on your shoulders but I've got few friends here. Come to a decision quickly.
[eyvind] Rook, I need your help. Take me to Sigrholm. Juno is going to meet us there.
[eyvind] She's my mentor... on the mender council. She contacted me.
[eyvind] She's not like most menders. What happened here since I passed out?
[eyvind] So they did. They ended the war, pushed the dredge into the north and formed an alliance that has held ever since.
[eyvind] Speak to Jorundr yourself. He's in the great hall. Maybe you'll have more luck. Or maybe he'll put your head on a spike.
[eyvind] That's another story. I... there's nothing in the menders' libraries about that thing.
[eyvind] That seems likely.
[eyvind] That's why I need your help.
[eyvind] Then one of the gods created the dredge, and they were such a threat that unless men and varl set aside their differences, they threatened to wipe out both races.
[eyvind] The second great war began generations later. The dredge rallied their forces, defeated the varl who watched the borders and laid waste to unsuspecting settlements throughout the world.
[eyvind] They were led by Sundr, powerful dredge warlords and weavers, like Bellower. He was there in the second great war.
[eyvind] Those menders were called Valka. Juno wasn't there herself, but she's from their bloodline.
[eyvind] You know how men and varl were made... the Loom-mother, the other gods.
[rook alette] Can he hear us? He just moved...
[rook eyvind] Sigrholm? That's got to be a week away, at least. And just abandon Einartoft?
[rook] Hold on, slow down. Who's Juno?
[rook] I need to understand a few things, Eyvind.
[rook] Jorundr sent Hakon and a couple hundred varl away to Arberrang. I don't know how long we'll be able to hold out here.
[rook] Jorundr sent Hakon, Ludin and a couple hundred varl away to Arberrang. I don't know how long we'll be able to hold out here.
[rook] So another great war has begun.
[rook] The varl are holding the dredge back, just barely. Bellower has disappeared. Iver is still out of it.
[rook] You've spent a lot of time next to him since he passed out.
[rook] You were out for a couple days. How do you feel?
{skip}
{skip} mark1=rook mark2=eyvind mark3=alette
/=You consider your options.=/

content.option: Why won't the varl king destroy the bridge?
How would you collapse that bridge by yourself?
What do we do about Bellower?
I need time to think about this
What is going on around here? That serpent? Bellower?
